I seen the lights go out on Broadway
I saw the ruins at my feet
You know we almost didn^Ã’t notice it
We seen it all the time
On Forty-Second street

They burned the churches up in Harlem
Like in that Spanish civil war
The flames were everywhere
But no one really cared
It always burned up there before

I seen the lights go out on Broadway
I watched the mighty skyline fall
The boats were waiting at the battery
The union went on strike
They never sailed at all

They sent a carrier out from Norfolk
And picked the Yankees up for free
They said that Queens could stay
They blew the Bronx away
And sank Manhattan out at sea

You know those lights were bright on Broadway
That was so many years ago
Before we all lived here in Florida
Before the Mafia
Took over Mexico

There are not many who remember
They say a handful still survive
To tell the world about
The way the lights went out
And keep the memory alive

title: Leningrad
raw_tab:
(<u>G</u>)  Viktor was (<u>Am</u>)born (<u>C</u>)in spring of (<u>D</u>)'44
(<u>G</u>)  And he never (<u>Am</u>)saw (<u>C</u>)his father (<u>D</u>)anymore
(<u>G</u>)  A child of (<u>Am</u>)sacrifice, (<u>G</u>)  a child of (<u>A7</u>)war
(<u>G</u>)  Another (<u>D</u>)son who never (<u>Em</u>)had a father(<u>C</u>) after (<u>D</u>)  Lenin(<u>G</u>)grad

(<u>G</u>)  Went of to (<u>Am</u>)school (<u>C</u>)and learned to (<u>D</u>)serve the state
(<u>G</u>)  Followed the (<u>Am</u>)rules (<u>C</u>) and drank his (<u>D</u>)vodka straight
(<u>G</u>)  The only (<u>Am</u>)way to live (<u>G</u>) was drown the (<u>A7</u>)hate
(<u>G</u>)  A Russian (<u>D</u>)life was very (<u>Em</u>)sad and such was (<u>C</u>)life in (<u>D</u>)  Lenin(<u>G</u>)grad

        (<u>Gm</u>)  I was born in '49 a (<u>Dm</u>)cold war kid in Mc Carthy time
        (<u>F</u>)Stop 'em a the 38th parallel (<u>D7</u>)blast those yellow reds to hell
        And (<u>Gm</u>)Cold War kids were hard to kill (<u>Dm</u>)under their desk in an air raid drill
        (<u>F</u>)Haven't they heard we won the war (<u>D7</u>)what do they keep on fighting for?

Viktor was sent to some Red Army town
Served out his time, became a circus clown
The greatest happiness he'd ever found
Was making russian children glad and children lived in Leningrad

        But children lived in Levitown and hid in the shelters underground
        Until the Soviets turned their ships around and tore all the cuban missles down
        And in that bright Oktober sun we knew our childhood days were done
        And I watched my friends go off to war what do they keep on fighting for?

And so my child and I come to this place
To meet him eye to eye and face to face
He made my daughter laugh, then we embraced
We never knew what friends we had until we came to Leningrad

title: Laura
raw_tab:
"Laura" Intro: Bb Ab Gb Eb Verse: Bb Gm C7/G Laura calls me in the middle of the night C7 Ebm7 Passes on her painful information Bb Bb/A Gm C7/G Then these careless fingers, they get caught in her vice C7 F#7 Til they're bleeding on my coffee table
B7 F7 Gm Living alone isn't all that it's cracked up to be F#7 Oh whoa whoa B7 F7 Gm I'm on her side, why does she push the poison on me? F#7 B* Bb Oh whoa whoa whoa whoa
(*First Chorus only) Verse: Laura has a very hard time All her life has been one long disaster Then she tells me she suddenly believes she's seen a very good sign She'll be taking some aggressive action Chorus: I fight her wars while she's slamming her doors in my face Oh whoa whoa Failure to break was the only mistake that she made Oh whoa whoa Bridge: Db Eb7 Here I am feeling like a fucking fool Ebdim/A Ab Db Do I react the way exactly she intends me to? Db Db /F Eb7 Every time I think I'm off the hook she makes me lose my cool Ebdim/A Ab I'm her machine and she can punch all the keys Ebdim/A F And she can push any button I was programmed through Verse: Laura calls me when she needs a good fix All her questions will get sympathetic Answers I should be so immunized to all of her tricks She's surviving on her second chances Chorus: Sometimes I feel like this Godfather deal is all wrong How can she hold an umbilical chord for so long? *Instrumental Break* Db Eb7 Edim/A Ab Db Bridge: I've done everything I can what else am I supposed to do I'm her machine and she can punch all the keys And she can push any button I was programmed through Verse: Laura loves me even if I don't care That's my problem that's her sacred absolution If she had to she would put herself in my chair Even though I faced electrocution Chorus: She always says I'm the best friend that she's ever had How do you hang up on someone who needs you that bad? Outro: Bb Ab Gb Eb

B7 F7 Gm Living alone isn't all that it's cracked up to be F#7 Oh whoa whoa B7 F7 Gm I'm on her side, why does she push the poison on me? F#7 B* Bb Oh whoa whoa whoa whoa
(*First Chorus only) Verse: Laura has a very hard time All her life has been one long disaster Then she tells me she suddenly believes she's seen a very good sign She'll be taking some aggressive action Chorus: I fight her wars while she's slamming her doors in my face Oh whoa whoa Failure to break was the only mistake that she made Oh whoa whoa Bridge: Db Eb7 Here I am feeling like a fucking fool Ebdim/A Ab Db Do I react the way exactly she intends me to? Db Db /F Eb7 Every time I think I'm off the hook she makes me lose my cool Ebdim/A Ab I'm her machine and she can punch all the keys Ebdim/A F And she can push any button I was programmed through Verse: Laura calls me when she needs a good fix All her questions will get sympathetic Answers I should be so immunized to all of her tricks She's surviving on her second chances Chorus: Sometimes I feel like this Godfather deal is all wrong How can she hold an umbilical chord for so long? *Instrumental Break* Db Eb7 Edim/A Ab Db Bridge: I've done everything I can what else am I supposed to do I'm her machine and she can punch all the keys And she can push any button I was programmed through Verse: Laura loves me even if I don't care That's my problem that's her sacred absolution If she had to she would put herself in my chair Even though I faced electrocution Chorus: She always says I'm the best friend that she's ever had How do you hang up on someone who needs you that bad? Outro: Bb Ab Gb Eb

title: Honesty
raw_tab:
Intro: Bb Bbm Gbmaj7 F7 Bb Eb F Dm7 If you search for tenderness, it isn't hard to find Eb Gm Am You can have the love you need to live Cm7 F F7 Bb C F A Dm And if you look for truthfulness you might just as well be blind Eb A D D4 D no3 It always seems to be so hard to give
Ebm7 F7 D Gm7 F Honesty is such a lonely word Eb F Bb D Everyone is so untrue Ebmaj7 F7 D Gm7 Honesty is hardly ever heard Eb F Bb F4/9 But mostly what I need from you
Bb Eb F Dm7 I can always find someone to say they sympathize Eb Gm Am Cm7 F F7 If I wear my heart out on my sleeve Bb C F A Dm But I don't want some pretty face to tell me pretty lies Eb A D D4 D no3 All I want is someone to believe
Ebm7 F7 D Gm7 F Honesty is such a lonely word Eb F Bb D Everyone is so untrue Ebmaj7 F7 D Gm7 Honesty is hardly ever heard Eb F Bb F4/9 But mostly what I need from you
Gm D I can find a lover, I can find a friend F7 C I can have security until the bitter end Eb F F7 Eb Bb Anyone can comfort me with promises again C7 F D Eb F4/9 I know, I know-oh-wo-wo-wo Bb Eb F Dm When I'm deep inside of me, don't be too concerned Eb Bb Am Cm7 F F7 I won't ask for nothing while I'm gone Bb C F A Dm When I want sincerity, tell me where else can I turn? Eb A7 D7 'Cause you're the one that I depend upon {c:coda} Bb Bbm Gbmaj7 F7 Ebm7 F6 F7 Bb

title: Famous Last Words
raw_tab: Intro: C C F F (2x) C F Sitting here in Avalon, looking at the pouring rain C F Summer time has come and gone, and everybody's home again G Bb C Closing down for the season, I found the last of the souvenirs G Bb C I can still taste the wedding cake and it's sweet after all these years Chorus: F Bb C These are the last words I have to say F Bb C That's why this took so long to write F Bb C There will be other words some other day F Bb C But that's the story of my life C F There's comfort in my coffee cup and apples in the early fall C F They're pulling all the moorings up and gathering at the Legion Hall G Bb C They swept away all the streamers after the Labor Day parade G Bb C Nothing left for a dreamer now, only one final serenade Chorus: F Bb C And these are the last words I have to say F Bb C Before another age goes by F Bb C With all those other songs I'll have to play F Bb C G F But that's the story of my life F Bb F C And it's so clear standing here where I am Eb Bb F Ain't that what justice is for? Ab Eb Bb F C Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn anymore Solo: C C F F C C F F G Stack the chairs on the table tops Bb F Hang the sheets on the chandeliers G It slows down but it never stops Bb F Ain't it sweet after all these years Chorus: F Bb C And these are the last words I have to say F Bb C It's always hard to say goodbye F Bb C But now it's time to put this book away F Bb C Ain't that the story of my life Chorus: F Bb C These are the last words I have to say F Bb C That's why this took so long to write F Bb C There will be other words some other day F Bb C But that's the story of my life Chorus: F Bb C And these are the last words I have to say F Bb C Before another age goes by F Bb C With all those other songs I'll have to play F Bb C But that's the story of my life Outro: C C F F

as long as six weeks on Parris Island.

title: Good night saigon
raw_tab:
<u>F</u>  <u>Dm</u>  <u>Bb</u>  <u>G</u>     
           <u>Dm</u>            <u>Dm7</u>    <u>C</u>        
We met as soul mates on Parris Island, 
           <u>Dm</u>           <u>Dm7</u> <u>C</u> 
we left as inmates from an asylum. 
            <u>Em</u>    <u>Am</u>           <u>Em</u>     <u>Am</u> 
And we were sharp, as sharp as knives 
            <u>Dm</u>            <u>Dm/C</u>         <u>G</u>       <u>C</u> <u>G</u> 
and we were so gung-ho to lay down our lives. 
 
           <u>Dm</u>           <u>Dm7</u>      <u>C</u> 
We came in spastic like tameless horses, 
           <u>Dm</u>         <u>Dm7</u>      <u>C</u> 
we left in plastic as numbered corpses. 
               <u>Em</u>  <u>Am</u>         <u>Em</u>     <u>Am</u> 
And we learned fast to travel light,  
              <u>Dm</u>            <u>C</u>            <u>Bb</u>      <u>G</u>  <u>Dm</u>  <u>G</u>  
our arms were heavy but our bellies were tight. 
 
          <u>Dm</u>             <u>Dm7</u>    <u>C</u> 
We had no home front, we had no soft soap. 
             <u>Dm</u>            <u>Dm7</u>     <u>C</u> 
They sent us Playboy, they gave us Bob Hope. 
          <u>Em</u> <u>Am</u>            <u>Em</u>     <u>Am</u> 
We dug in deep and shot on sight 
              <u>Dm</u>                <u>F</u>          <u>G</u>       <u>C</u> <u>G</u> 
and prayed to Jesus Christ with all of our might. 
 
          <u>Dm</u>         <u>Dm7</u>       <u>C</u> 
We had no cameras to shoot the landscape 
              <u>Dm</u>            <u>Dm7</u>        <u>C</u> 
we passed the hash pipe and played our Doors tapes. 
           <u>Em</u>  <u>Am</u>           <u>Em</u>     <u>Am</u> 
And it was dark, so dark at night 
            <u>Dm</u>                     <u>Dm/C</u>            
and we held on to each other, like brother to brother, 
   <u>Bb</u>           <u>F6/A</u>         <u>G</u> 
we promised our mothers we'd write. 
 
             <u>F</u>      <u>Bb</u>     <u>C</u>       <u>C7</u> 
And we would all go down together, 
             <u>F</u>      <u>Bb</u>     <u>C</u>       <u>C7</u> 
we said we'd all go down together, 
              <u>F</u>      <u>Bb</u>     <u>G</u>       <u>F</u> <u>Dm</u> <u>C</u> 
yes, we would all go down together.

                <u>Dm</u>           <u>Dm7</u>   <u>C</u>

title: Famous Last Words
raw_tab: Intro: C C F F (2x) C F Sitting here in Avalon, looking at the pouring rain C F Summer time has come and gone, and everybody's home again G Bb C Closing down for the season, I found the last of the souvenirs G Bb C I can still taste the wedding cake and it's sweet after all these years Chorus: F Bb C These are the last words I have to say F Bb C That's why this took so long to write F Bb C There will be other words some other day F Bb C But that's the story of my life C F There's comfort in my coffee cup and apples in the early fall C F They're pulling all the moorings up and gathering at the Legion Hall G Bb C They swept away all the streamers after the Labor Day parade G Bb C Nothing left for a dreamer now, only one final serenade Chorus: F Bb C And these are the last words I have to say F Bb C Before another age goes by F Bb C With all those other songs I'll have to play F Bb C G F But that's the story of my life F Bb F C And it's so clear standing here where I am Eb Bb F Ain't that what justice is for? Ab Eb Bb F C Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn anymore Solo: C C F F C C F F G Stack the chairs on the table tops Bb F Hang the sheets on the chandeliers G It slows down but it never stops Bb F Ain't it sweet after all these years Chorus: F Bb C And these are the last words I have to say F Bb C It's always hard to say goodbye F Bb C But now it's time to put this book away F Bb C Ain't that the story of my life Chorus: F Bb C These are the last words I have to say F Bb C That's why this took so long to write F Bb C There will be other words some other day F Bb C But that's the story of my life Chorus: F Bb C And these are the last words I have to say F Bb C Before another age goes by F Bb C With all those other songs I'll have to play F Bb C But that's the story of my life Outro: C C F F

title: Downeaster Alexa
raw_tab:
Intro: |<u>Am</u>   <u>G</u>|<u>Am</u>   |<u>Am</u>   <u>G</u>|<u>Am</u>   |

         <u>C</u>          <u>G</u>         <u>Am</u>
Well I'm on the Downeaster Alexa
        <u>C</u>                <u>G</u>              <u>F</u>
And I'm cruising through Block Island Sound.
       <u>F</u>           <u>C</u>                <u>Dm</u>
I have chartered a course to the Vineyard.
         <u>C</u>       <u>G</u>              <u>F</u> <u>C</u> <u>F</u>    
But tonight I am Nantucket bound.

           <u>G</u>              <u>C/E</u>                <u>F</u>
We took on diesel back in Montauk yesterday,
              <u>G</u>                  <u>Am</u>                  <u>G/B</u>   <u>F</u>
And left this morning from the bell in Gardiner's Bay.
              <u>G</u>               <u>C/E</u>             <u>F</u>
Like all the locals here I've had to sell my home,
             <u>G</u>                  <u>Am</u>                <u>G/B</u>
Too proud to leave, I worked my fingers to the bone

So I could own my Downeaster Alexa,
And I go where the ocean is deep.
There are giants out there in the canyons.
And a good captain can't fall asleep.

I got bills to pay and children who need clothes.
I know there's fish out there but where, God only knows.
They say these waters aren't what they used to be.
But I've got people back on land who count on me.

So when you see my Downeaster Alexa,
And if you work with the rod and the reel,
Tell my wife I am trolling Atlantis,
And I still have my hands on the wheel.

Instrumental Bridge: |<u>Am</u>   <u>G</u>|<u>Am</u>   |<u>Am</u>   <u>G</u>|<u>Am</u>   |
                     |<u>Em</u>    |     |      |     |
                     |<u>Am</u>    |     |      |     |
            
Now I drive my Downeaster Alexa
More and more miles from shore ev'ry year,
Since they told me I can't sell no stripers.
And there's no luck in sword fishing here.

I was a bayman like my father was before.
Can't make a living as a bayman anymore.
There ain't much future for a man who works the sea.
But there ain't no island left for islanders like me.

          <u>C</u> <u>G</u>   <u>Am</u>
Ya, ya, ya   yo     
          <u>C</u> <u>G</u>   <u>Am</u>
Ya, ya, ya   yo     
          <u>C</u> <u>G</u>   <u>Am</u>
Ya, ya, ya   yo     
          <u>C</u> <u>G</u>   <u>Am</u>
Ya, ya, ya   yo

title: All Shook Up
raw_tab:
Written by Otis Blackwell. This is legend, Billy Joel's version.  


  <u>G</u>  
1. A well a bless my soul  

What's wrong with me?  

I'm itching like a man  

On a fuzzy tree.  

My friends say I'm actin'  

As queer as a bug  

I'm in love!  

I'm All Shook Up.  
          <u>C</u>         <u>D</u>          <u>G</u> 

2. My hands are shaky  
And my knees are weak  
I can't seem to stand  
On my own two feet  
Who do you thank  
When you have such luck?  
I'm in love! I'm All Shook Up.  
Uh uh huh. MM Yeah, yeah.  

   <u>C</u>                                           
Please don't ask what's on my mind  
   <u>G</u>                                     <u>G</u>  
I'm a little mixed up, but I'm feelin' fine  
   <u>C</u>                                          <u>C</u> 
When I'm near that girl that I love the best  
   <u>D</u>                           <u>D</u> 7 
My heart beats so it scares me to death  

3. She touched my hand  
What a chill I got  
Her kisses are like  
A volcano that's hot  
I'm proud to say  
That she's my buttercup  
I'm in love! I'm All Shook Up.  
Uh uh huh. Mmm  Yeah, yeah.  

My tongue gets tied when I try to speak  
My insides shake like a leaf on a tree  
There's only one cure for this body of mine  
That's to have the girl that I love so fine  

(repeat 3rd verse)  

(I have submitted a rather simplified, everyman version of this classic  
Elvis, because I thought the collection needed a version. All  
corrections and suggestions welcomed at Dgtalji@hotmail.com or at the  
address below)  

Enjoy!

  <u>G</u>  
1. A well a bless my soul  

What's wrong with me?  

I'm itching like a man  

On a fuzzy tree.  

My friends say I'm actin'  

As queer as a bug  

I'm in love!  

I'm All Shook Up.  
          <u>C</u>         <u>D</u>          <u>G</u> 

2. My hands are shaky  
And my knees are weak  
I can't seem to stand  
On my own two feet  
Who do you thank  
When you have such luck?  
I'm in love! I'm All Shook Up.  
Uh uh huh. MM Yeah, yeah.  

   <u>C</u>                                           
Please don't ask what's on my mind  
   <u>G</u>                                     <u>G</u>  
I'm a little mixed up, but I'm feelin' fine  
   <u>C</u>                                          <u>C</u> 
When I'm near that girl that I love the best  
   <u>D</u>                           <u>D</u> 7 
My heart beats so it scares me to death  

3. She touched my hand  
What a chill I got  
Her kisses are like  
A volcano that's hot  
I'm proud to say  
That she's my buttercup  
I'm in love! I'm All Shook Up.  
Uh uh huh. Mmm  Yeah, yeah.  

My tongue gets tied when I try to speak  
My insides shake like a leaf on a tree  
There's only one cure for this body of mine  
That's to have the girl that I love so fine  

(repeat 3rd verse)  

(I have submitted a rather simplified, everyman version of this classic  
Elvis, because I thought the collection needed a version. All  
corrections and suggestions welcomed at Dgtalji@hotmail.com or at the  
address below)  

Enjoy!

title: A matter of trust
raw_tab: Intro: D Bm D Bm Some love is just a lie of the heart D Bm F#m The cold remains of what began with a passionate start F#m And they may not want it to end A A7 D But it will, it's just a question of when I've lived long enough to have learned The closer you get to the fire the more you get burned But that won't happen to us Because it's always been a matter of trust I know you're an emotional girl It took a lot for you to not lose your faith in this world I can't offer you proof But you're gonna face a moment of truth It's hard when you're always afraid You just recover when another belief is betrayed So break my heart if you must It's a matter of trust G You can't go the distance Bm With too much resistance Em A I know you have doubts Dmaj7 G A D But for God's sake don't shut me out This time you've got nothing to lose You can take it, you can leave it Whatever you choose I won't hold back anything And I'll walk away a fool or a king Some love is just a lie of the mind It's make believe until it's only a matter of time And some might have learned to adjust But then it never was a matter of trust I'm sure you're aware love We've both had our share of Believing too long When the whole situation was wrong Some love is just a lie of the soul A constant battle for the ultimate state of control After you've heard lie upon lie There can hardly be a question of why Some love is just a lie of the heart The cold remains of what began with a passionate start But that can't happen to us Because it's always been a matter of trust

title: Summer highland fall
raw_tab: Intro: F(no 3) Fmaj7 Gm7 Bb2 Am7 C Bb2 F Fmaj7 They say that these are not the best of times Gm7 Bb2 F Fmaj7 Gm7 Bb2 But they're the only times I've ever known F Fmaj7 Gm7 And I believe there is a time for meditation Bb2 C G C In cathedrals of our own A7 Dm C Bb2 F Now I've seen that sad surrender in my lover's eyes G7/sus4 G7 Csus4 C And I can only stand apart and sympathize Bb F Gm7 For we are always what our situations hand us C Bb2 Eb Bb It's either sadness or euphoria So we'll argue and we'll compromise And realize that nothing's ever changed For all our mutual experience Out separate conclusions are the same. Now we are forced to recognize our inhumanity Our reason coexists with our insanity And though we choose between reality and madness It's either sadness or euphoria Dm C Bb2 F How thoughtlessly we dissipate our energies G7/sus4 G7 Csus4 C Perhaps we don't fulfill each other's fantasies Bb F Gm7 And as we stand upon the ledges of our lives C Bb2 Eb Bb With our respective similarities C F It's either sadness or euphoria.

title: Sometimes A Fantasy
raw_tab:
This tab is of Sometimes a Fantasy from Billy Joel's 1980 album, Glass Houses. Intro: A D x2 verse 1: D D A I didn't want to do it but I got too lonely D A I had to call you up in the middle of the night G D I know it's awful hard to try to make love long distance C Em But I really needed stimulation G A Though it was only my imagination

title: She's Aways A Woman To Me
raw_tab:
1st VERSE no tempo until the last Eb Bb Eb Bb Eb (pause) She can kill with a smile, she can wound with her eyes Eb Ab Abm7 Ab6 Abm7 She can ruin your faith with her casual lies Bb Eb Bb G (pause) And she only reveals what she wants you to see Cm Cm/Bb Ab Bb Eb (tempo) She hides like a child, but she's always a woman to me Ab Eb VERSE Bb Eb Bb Eb She can lead you to love, she can take you or leave you Eb Ab Abm7 Ab6 Abm7 She can ask for the truth, but she'll never believe Bb Eb Bb G And she'll take what you give her as long it's free Cm Cm/Bb Ab Bb Eb She steals like a thief, but she's always a woman to me Ab Eb Bb/D
Cm Cm/Bb F7/A F Bb Dm/A Gm Ohhh... she takes care of herself. Eb Ab Ab/G Fm Bb Eb Ab Eb She can wait if she wants, she's ahead of her time. Ebm F#/C# Ab/C Ab C# C#/C Bbm Ohhh... and she never gives out, Bbm/F# B B/Bb F7/A F Bb Bb6 Bb7 and she never gives in, she just changes her mind.
VERSE Bb6 Eb Bb Eb And she'll promise you more than the garden of Eden Eb Ab Abm7 Ab6 Abm7 Then she'll carelessly cut you and laugh while you're bleeding. Bb Eb Bb G But she bring out the best and the worst you can be Cm Cm/Bb Ab Bb Eb Blame it all on yourself 'cause she's always a women to me. Ab Eb Hum last part of verse Bb Eb Bb G Cm Cm/Bb Ab Bb Eb Ab Eb Eb/D
Cm Cm/Bb F7/A F Bb Dm/A Gm Ohhh... she takes care of herself. Eb Ab Ab/G Fm Bb Eb Ab Eb She can wait if she wants, she's ahead of her time. Ebm F#/C# Ab/C Ab C# C#/C Bbm Ohhh... and she never gives out, Bbm/F# B B/Bb F7/A F Bb Bb6 Bb7 and she never gives in, she just changes her mind.
VERSE Bb6 Eb Bb Eb She's frequently kind and she's suddenly cruel. Eb Ab Abm7 Ab6 Abm7 She can do as she pleases, she's nobody's fool. Bb Eb Bb G But she can't be convicted, she's earned her degree. Cm Cm/Bb Ab Eb/G And the most she will do is throw shadows at you, Fm Bb Eb Ebsus4 Eb but she's always a woman to me Bb Eb Bb G Cm Cm/Bb Ab Bb Eb Ebsus4 Eb

title: Shameless
raw_tab: Intro G D Em C Bb repeat 1. G D Well, I'm shameless when it comes to loving you, Em C Bb I'll do anything you want me to, I'll do anything at all G D And I'm standing here for all the world to see. Em C Bb Oh, baby, that's what's left of me, don't have very far to fall. 2. D B You know now I'm not a man who's ever been Em Am7 G Insecure about the world I've been living in. D B I don't break easy, I have my pride, Em F F# But if you need to be satisfied, (chords like section 1.) I'm shameless. Baby, I don't have a prayer. Every time I see you standing there I go down upon my knees And I'm changing, swore I'd never compromise, Aw, but you convinced me otherwise. I'll do anything you please. (chords like section 2. except as noted) You see, in all my life I've never found What I couldn't resist, what I couldn't turn down. I could walk away from anyone I ever knew Em F Gm F But I can't talk away from you. Bb Am I have never let anything have this much control over me. Ab Eb I worked too hard to call my life my own Bb Am And I've made myself a world and it's worked so perfectly, Ab But it's your world now, I can't refuse. Am D7 I've never had so much to lose. G Oh, I'm shameless. (guitar solo - chords like section 1.) (chords like section 2. except as noted) You knowm it should be easy for a man who's strong To say he's sorry or admit when he's wrong. I never lost anything, I ever missed, Em F But I've never been in love like this. It's out of my hands, (chords like section 1.) I'm shameless, I don't have the power now. I don't want it anyhow so I've got to let it go. I'm shameless, shameless as a man can be. You could make a jealous fool of me. I just wanted you to know. (vocal ad lib over guitar solo outro - chords like intro)

title: Say goodbye to hollywood
raw_tab: INTRO: C C Bobby's driving through the city tonight F Through the lights in a hot new rent-a-car C He joins the lovers in his heavy machine F It's a scene down on Sunset Boulevard Chorus 1: Dm7 Say goodbye to Hollywood G Am Say goodbye my baby F Say goodbye to Hollywood Dm7 C Say goodbye my baby C Johnny's taking care of things for awhile F And his style is so right for troubadors C They got him sitting with his back to the door F Now he won't be my fast gun anymore Chorus 2 Cmaj7 B Em C G D Moving on is a chance you take any time you try to stay together, Oh Cmaj7 B Em C Say a word out of line and you find that the friends you had are gone G Dm G Forever...forev...er C So many faces in and out of my life F Some will last, some will just be now and then C Life is a series of hellos and good-byes F I'm afraid it's time for goodbye again Chorus 3 INSTRUMENTAL: F C F Dm7 G Am F Dm7 C Cmaj7 B Em C G D Moving on is a chance you take any time you try to stay together, Oh Cmaj7 B Em C Say a word out of line and you find that the friends you had are gone G Dm G Forever...forev...er C So many faces in and out of my life F Some will last, some will just be now and then C Life is a series of hellos and good-byes F I'm afraid it's time for goodbye again Chorus 4 OUTRO: C F C F Dm7 G Am F Dm7

title: Shameless
raw_tab: Intro G D Em C Bb repeat 1. G D Well, I'm shameless when it comes to loving you, Em C Bb I'll do anything you want me to, I'll do anything at all G D And I'm standing here for all the world to see. Em C Bb Oh, baby, that's what's left of me, don't have very far to fall. 2. D B You know now I'm not a man who's ever been Em Am7 G Insecure about the world I've been living in. D B I don't break easy, I have my pride, Em F F# But if you need to be satisfied, (chords like section 1.) I'm shameless. Baby, I don't have a prayer. Every time I see you standing there I go down upon my knees And I'm changing, swore I'd never compromise, Aw, but you convinced me otherwise. I'll do anything you please. (chords like section 2. except as noted) You see, in all my life I've never found What I couldn't resist, what I couldn't turn down. I could walk away from anyone I ever knew Em F Gm F But I can't talk away from you. Bb Am I have never let anything have this much control over me. Ab Eb I worked too hard to call my life my own Bb Am And I've made myself a world and it's worked so perfectly, Ab But it's your world now, I can't refuse. Am D7 I've never had so much to lose. G Oh, I'm shameless. (guitar solo - chords like section 1.) (chords like section 2. except as noted) You knowm it should be easy for a man who's strong To say he's sorry or admit when he's wrong. I never lost anything, I ever missed, Em F But I've never been in love like this. It's out of my hands, (chords like section 1.) I'm shameless, I don't have the power now. I don't want it anyhow so I've got to let it go. I'm shameless, shameless as a man can be. You could make a jealous fool of me. I just wanted you to know. (vocal ad lib over guitar solo outro - chords like intro)

       <u>F</u>                <u>Dm7</u>            <u>G</u>

<u>C</u>        <u>C/B</u>            <u>C7sus4</u>
When you touch my weary head
        <u>F</u>            <u>Dm7</u>             <u>G</u>
And you tell me everything will be alright
          <u>C</u>      <u>C/B</u>           <u>C7sus4</u>
You say, "Use my body for your bed.
       <u>F</u>                  <u>Dm7</u>                 <u>G</u>
And my love will keep you warm throughout the night."
 
       <u>Em7</u>        <u>Em7</u>               <u>F</u>     <u>F/E</u> <u>Dm7</u>
Well I never be a stranger and I'll never be  alone
    <u>F</u>            <u>G</u>                 <u>C</u>      <u>C</u>  <u>C/B</u>
Wherever we're together, that's my home.
 
<u>Am</u>              <u>G</u>            <u>C</u>         <u>C</u>  <u>C/B</u>
Home can be the Pennsylvania Turnpike,
 
<u>Am</u>        <u>G</u>             <u>F</u>
Indiana's early morning dew, oh!
<u>Am</u>             <u>G</u>            <u>C</u>       <u>C</u>  <u>C/B</u>
High up in the hills of California,
<u>Am</u>            <u>G</u>               <u>F</u>
Home is just another word for you.
 
 
>
 
       <u>Em7</u>         <u>Em7</u>                <u>F</u>       <u>F/E</u>  <u>Dm7</u>
Well I never had a place that I could call my very own.
    <u>F</u>                  <u>G</u>                      <u>C</u>   <u>C/B</u>   <u>Fsus4</u>   <u>G</u>
But that's alright, my love, 'cause you're my home.
 
<u>C</u>        <u>C/B</u>           <u>C7sus4</u>
And if I travel all my life
      <u>F</u>            <u>Dm7</u>             <u>G</u>
And I never get to stop and settle down
<u>C</u>         <u>C/B</u>            <u>C7sus4</u>
Long as I have you by my side, oh
        <u>F</u>                 <u>Dm7</u>              <u>G</u>
There's room for love and good wars(?) all around.
 
          <u>Em7</u>               <u>Em7</u>           <u>F</u>       <u>F/E</u>      <u>Dm7</u>
You're my castle, you're my cabin, and my instant pleasure dome.
  <u>F</u>              <u>G</u>                       <u>C</u>   <u>C/B</u>   <u>Fsus4</u>   <u>G</u>
I need you in my house, 'cause you're my home.
 
          <u>C</u>  <u>C/B</u>  <u>Fsus4</u>  <u>G</u>  <u>C</u>  <u>C/B</u>  <u>Fsus4</u>  <u>G</u>  <u>C</u>  <u>C/B</u>  <u>Fsus4</u>  <u>G</u>
You're my ho - me.

raw_tab: INTRO: C C Bobby's driving through the city tonight F Through the lights in a hot new rent-a-car C He joins the lovers in his heavy machine F It's a scene down on Sunset Boulevard Chorus 1: Dm7 Say goodbye to Hollywood G Am Say goodbye my baby F Say goodbye to Hollywood Dm7 C Say goodbye my baby C Johnny's taking care of things for awhile F And his style is so right for troubadors C They got him sitting with his back to the door F Now he won't be my fast gun anymore Chorus 2 Cmaj7 B Em C G D Moving on is a chance you take any time you try to stay together, Oh Cmaj7 B Em C Say a word out of line and you find that the friends you had are gone G Dm G Forever...forev...er C So many faces in and out of my life F Some will last, some will just be now and then C Life is a series of hellos and good-byes F I'm afraid it's time for goodbye again Chorus 3 INSTRUMENTAL: F C F Dm7 G Am F Dm7 C Cmaj7 B Em C G D Moving on is a chance you take any time you try to stay together, Oh Cmaj7 B Em C Say a word out of line and you find that the friends you had are gone G Dm G Forever...forev...er C So many faces in and out of my life F Some will last, some will just be now and then C Life is a series of hellos and good-byes F I'm afraid it's time for goodbye again Chorus 4 OUTRO: C F C F Dm7 G Am F Dm7

title: The downester alexa
raw_tab: Intro: |Am G|Am |Am G|Am | C G Am Well I'm on the Downeaster Alexa C G F And I'm cruising through Block Island Sound. F C Dm I have chartered a course to the Vineyard. C G F C F But tonight I am Nantucket bound. G C/E F We took on diesel back in Montauk yesterday, G Am G/B F And left this morning from the bell in Gardiner's Bay. G C/E F Like all the locals here I've had to sell my home, G Am G/B Too proud to leave, I worked my fingers to the bone So I could own my Downeaster Alexa, And I go where the ocean is deep. There are giants out there in the canyons. And a good captain can't fall asleep. I got bills to pay and children who need clothes. I know there's fish out there but where, God only knows. They say these waters aren't what they used to be. But I've got people back on land who count on me. So when you see my Downeaster Alexa, And if you work with the rod and the reel, Tell my wife I am trolling Atlantis, And I still have my hands on the wheel. Instrumental Bridge: |Am G|Am |Am G|Am | |Em | | | | |Am | | | | Now I drive my Downeaster Alexa More and more miles from shore ev'ry year, Since they told me I can't sell no stripers. And there's no luck in sword fishing here. I was a bayman like my father was before. Can't make a living as a bayman anymore. There ain't much future for a man who works the sea. But there ain't no island left for islanders like me. C G Am Ya, ya, ya yo C G Am Ya, ya, ya yo C G Am Ya, ya, ya yo C G Am Ya, ya, ya yo

title: The Downeaster Alexa
raw_tab:
Intro    <u>Am</u>   <u>G</u>   <u>Am</u>    <u>Am</u>   <u>G</u>   <u>Am</u>    
  
         <u>C</u>          <u>G</u>         <u>Am</u>  
Well I'm on the Downeaster Alexa  
        <u>C</u>                <u>G</u>              <u>F</u>  
And I'm cruising through Block Island Sound.  
       <u>F</u>           <u>C</u>                <u>Dm</u>  
I have chartered a course to the Vineyard.  
         <u>C</u>       <u>G</u>              <u>F</u> <u>C</u> <u>F</u>      
But tonight I am Nantucket bound.  
  
           <u>G</u>              <u>C/E</u>                <u>F</u>  
We took on diesel back in Montauk yesterday,  
              <u>G</u>                  <u>Am</u>                  <u>G/B</u>   <u>F</u>  
And left this morning from the bell in Gardiner's Bay.  
              <u>G</u>               <u>C/E</u>             <u>F</u>  
Like all the locals here I've had to sell my home,  
             <u>G</u>                  <u>Am</u>                <u>G/B</u>  
Too proud to leave, I worked my fingers to the bone  
  
So I could own my Downeaster Alexa,  
And I go where the ocean is deep.  
There are giants out there in the canyons.  
And a good captain can't fall asleep.  
  
I got bills to pay and children who need clothes.  
I know there's fish out there but where, God only knows.  
They say these waters aren't what they used to be.  
But I've got people back on land who count on me.  
  
So when you see my Downeaster Alexa,  
And if you work with the rod and the reel,  
Tell my wife I am trolling Atlantis,  
And I still have my hands on the wheel.

title: Summer, Highland Falls
raw_tab:
Intro:  <u>F</u>(no 3)  <u>Fmaj7</u>    <u>Gm7</u>    <u>Bb2</u>
        <u>Am7</u>      <u>C</u>        <u>Bb2</u>

              <u>F</u>                 <u>Fmaj7</u>
They say that these are not the best of times
    <u>Gm7</u>                <u>Bb2</u>               <u>F</u>  <u>Fmaj7</u>  <u>Gm7</u>  <u>Bb2</u>
But they're the only times I've ever known
        <u>F</u>                <u>Fmaj7</u>         <u>Gm7</u>
And I believe there is a time for meditation
     <u>Bb2</u>               <u>C</u>  <u>G</u> <u>C</u>
In cathedrals of our own
<u>A7</u>       <u>Dm</u>               <u>C</u>            <u>Bb2</u>        <u>F</u>
Now I've seen that sad surrender in my lover's eyes
    <u>G7sus</u>      <u>G7</u>              <u>Csus</u>      <u>C</u>
And I can only stand apart and sympathize
           <u>Bb</u>              <u>F</u>            <u>Gm7</u>
For we are always what our situations hand us
            <u>C</u>         <u>Bb2</u>     <u>Eb</u>  <u>Bb</u>
It's either sadness or euphoria

So we'll argue and we'll compromise
And realize that nothing's ever changed
For all our mutual experience
Out separate conclusions are the same.
Now we are forced to recognize our inhumanity
Our reason coexists with our insanity
And though we choose between reality and madness
It's either sadness or euphoria

    <u>Dm</u>               <u>C</u>             <u>Bb2</u>    <u>F</u>
How thoughtlessly we dissipate our energies
   <u>G7sus</u>            <u>G7</u>                <u>Csus</u>     <u>C</u>
Perhaps we don't fulfill each other's fantasies
          <u>Bb</u>             <u>F</u>             <u>Gm7</u>
And as we stand upon the ledges of our lives
           <u>C</u>            <u>Bb2</u>    <u>Eb</u>  <u>Bb</u>
With our respective similarities
            <u>C</u>         <u>F</u>
It's either sadness or euphoria.

at night he becomes abartender
he works at Mister Cacciatore's down
on Sulliven Street
across from the medical center
he's tradin' in his Chevy for a Cadillac
you ought to know by now
and if he can't drive with a broken back
at least he can polish the fenders.
It seems such awaste of time
if that's what it's all about
if that's movin' up then I'm movin' out.

You should never argue with a crazy mind
you ought to know by now
you can pay Uncle Sam with the overtime
is that all you get for your money?
It seems such awaste of time
if that's what it's all about
if that's movin' up then I'm movin' out.

<u>D</u> <u>G</u> <u>A</u>

title: New York state of mind
raw_tab: Intro: Dm9 Abmaj7 Dm9 Em7 F Dm9 F/G C E7 Am7 Gm7 C F A7 Dm Bb C E7/B Am7 G F C D9 Fmaj7 F/G Am7 D9 Am G F/G C E7 Am7 Gm7 C Some folks like to get away, take a holiday from the neighborhood F A7 Dm Bb Hop a flight to Miami Beach or to Hollywood C E7 Am7 Cmaj7 F C D7 But I'm taking a Greyhound on the Hudson River line Fmaj7 F/G Am D7 Am G F/G I'm in a New York state of mind C E7 Am7 Gm7 C I seen all the movie stars in their fancy cars and their limousines F A7 Dm Bb Been high in the Rockies under the evergreens C E7 Am7 Cmaj7 F C D7 But I know what I'm needing and I don't want to waste more time Fmaj7 F/G Am D9 Am G E7 I'm in a New York state of mind Am7 D7 Gmaj7 G It was so easy living day by day Gm7 C7 Fmaj7 Out of touch with the rhythm and blues Bm7 E7 Amaj7 Well, now I need a little give and take Am7 D7 The New York Times Gmaj7 Dm7 G7 The Daily News C E7 Am7 Gm7 C It comes down to reality and it's fine with me cause I've let it slide F A7 Dm Bb Don't care if it's Chinatown or on Riverside C E7 Am7 Cmaj7 F C D7 I don't have any reasons, I've left them all behind Fmaj7 F/G Am D9 Am G F/G I'm in a New York state of mind Solo: C E7 Am7 Gm7 C F A7 Dm Bb C E7 Am7 Cmaj7 F C D7 Fmaj7 F/G Am D7 Am G E7 Am7 D7 Gmaj7 -- G It was so easy living day by day Gm7 C7 Fmaj7 Out of touch with the rhythm and blues Bm7 E7 Amaj7 Well, now I need a little give and take Am7 D7 The New York Times Gmaj7 Dm7 F/G G7 The Daily News C E7 Am7 Gm7 C It comes down to reality and it's fine with me cause I've let it slide F A7 Dm Bb Don't care if it's Chinatown or on Riverside C E7 Am7 Cmaj7 F C D7 I don't have any reasons, I've left them all behind Fmaj7 F/G Am D7 Am G I'm in a New York state of mind C E7 Am7 Cmaj7 F C D7 I'm just taking a Greyhound on the Hudson River line Fmaj7 Cos I'm in a F/G I'm in a New York...state of... C C+ F Is that what you get for your money? Bb C It seems such a waste of time A7 Dm If that's what it's all about Gm7 Em A7 Dm If that's movin' up then I'm movin' out. title: Modern Woman
raw_tab:
Intro: F Eb6 F Eb6 F Eb6 F Eb6 (2x) verse 1: F Eb6 F Eb6 You see her sitting with her coffee and her paper F Eb6 F F13/A With her high top sneakers of Italian design Bb Ab6 Bb Ab6 With a long cool stare she aggravates the tension Bb Ab6 Bb C Makes up her face while she makes up her mind F Eb6 F Eb6 Now you're in trouble, maybe she's an intellectual F Eb6 F F13/A What if she figures out you're not very smart Bb Ab6 Bb Ab6 Or maybe she's the quiet type who's into heavy metal Bb Ab6 Bb Boy, you got to get it settled, cause she's breaking your heart
C Dm11 Don't try to put on an act Am7 Bb F/A Gm7 Bb/F C/E You can't do that to a modern woman C Dm11 And you're an old fashioned man Am7 Bb F/A Gm7 F She understands the things you're doin' Eb She's a modern woman
Intro: F Eb6 F Eb6 F Eb6 F Eb6 verse 2: F Eb6 F Eb6 She looks sleek and she seems so professional F Eb6 F F13/A She's got a lot of confidence, it's easy to see Bb Ab6 Bb Ab6 You want to make a move but you feel so inferior Bb Ab6 Bb C Cause under that exterior is someone who's free F Eb6 F Eb6 She's got style and she's got her own money F Eb6 F F13/A So she's not another honey you can quickly disarm Bb Ab6 Bb Ab6 She's got the eyes that make you realize Bb Ab6 Bb She won't be hypnotized by your usual charm
C Dm11 You've got your plan of attack Am7 Bb F/A Gm7 Bb/F C/E That won't attract the modern woman C Dm11 When you're an old fashioned man Am7 Bb F/A Gm7 F She understands the things you're doin' Eb She's a modern woman
Interlude: F Eb6 F Eb6 F Eb6 F Eb6 DbM7 Eb6 DbM7 AbM7 DbM7 Eb6 DbM7 Csus4 % F Eb6 F Eb6 F Eb6 F Eb6 verse 3: F Eb6 F Eb6 Time goes by and you're sharing an apartment F Eb6 F F13/A She says she loves you but she doesn't know why Bb Ab6 Bb Ab6 In the morning she leaves you with your coffee and your paper Bb Ab6 Bb C It's a strange situation for an old fashioned guy F Eb6 F Eb6 But times have changed things are not the same, baby F Eb6 F F13/A You overcame such a bad attitude Bb Ab6 Bb Ab6 Rock and roll just used to be for kicks and nowadays it's politics Bb Ab6 Bb And after 1986 what else could be new
C Dm11 You got to learn to relax Am7 Bb F/A Gm7 Bb/F C/E And face the facts of modern woman C Dm11 When you're an old fashioned man Am7 Bb F/A Gm7 F She understands the things you're doin' Eb She's a modern woman
Outro: F Eb6 F Eb6 F Eb6 F Eb6 (till fade)

title: Miami 2017/seen the lights go out on broadway
raw_tab:
<u>D</u>        <u>G/D</u>              <u>D</u>         <u>G/D</u>  <u>D</u>  <u>A/C#</u> 
Seen the lights go out on Broadway 
<u>Bm</u>        <u>G</u>                 <u>A</u>    <u>Asus</u> <u>A</u>  <u>G</u> 
I saw the Empire State laid low 
<u>D/F#</u>                        <u>G</u>          <u>Gsus</u>   <u>G</u> 
And life went on beyond the Palisades 
                <u>A</u>         <u>Asus</u>  <u>A</u> 
They all bought Cadillacs 
               <u>G</u>         <u>A</u> 
And left there long ago 
 
<u>D</u>            <u>G/D</u>           <u>D</u>         <u>G/D</u>  <u>D</u>  <u>A/C#</u> 
They held a concert out in Brooklyn 
<u>Bm</u>           <u>G</u>              <u>A</u>     <u>Asus</u> <u>A</u>  <u>G</u> 
To watch the island bridges blow 
<u>D/F#</u>            <u>G</u> 
They turned our power down 
<u>D/A</u>          <u>G/B</u> 
And drove us underground 
<u>A/C#</u>        <u>G/B</u> 
But we went right on with the show 
 
 
<u>A/D</u>  <u>D</u>       <u>G/D</u>  <u>D</u>  <u>A/D</u>  <u>D</u>      <u>A</u>  <u>D/A</u>  <u>A</u> 
 
 
(Repeat with same chords) 
 
I seen the lights go out on Broadway 
I saw the ruins at my feet 
You know we almost didn^Ã’t notice it 
We seen it all the time 
On Forty-Second street 
 
They burned the churches up in Harlem 
Like in that Spanish civil war 
The flames were everywhere 
But no one really cared 
It always burned up there before 
 
 
 
I seen the lights go out on Broadway 
I watched the mighty skyline fall 
The boats were waiting at the battery 
The union went on strike 
They never sailed at all 
 
They sent a carrier out from Norfolk 
And picked the Yankees up for free 
They said that Queens could stay 
They blew the Bronx away 
And sank Manhattan out at sea 
 
 
 
You know those lights were bright on Broadway 
That was so many years ago 
Before we all lived here in Florida 
Before the Mafia 
Took over Mexico 
 
There are not many who remember 
They say a handful still survive 
To tell the world about 
The way the lights went out 
And keep the memory alive 
 
("alive" is on a <u>G/D</u> chord, I play it X55433) 
 
(End with same as intro fingerstyle)
